episodeTitle: The Strongest Tag-Team! Luffy and Toriko's Hard Struggle!
description: The Straw Hat crew discovers Hungry-La Island while running low on food supplies. They encounter Toriko, a gourmet hunter, and his companion Komatsu. When Nami and Komatsu are kidnapped by Cocoalas, Luffy and Toriko team up to rescue them and discover the island's amazing secret.

events.title: Straw Hats Discover Hungry-La Island
events.description: The Straw Hat crew, running low on food supplies, discovers the legendary Hungry-La Island, a mysterious place said to be home to incredible food creatures.
events.significance: Sets up the main location for this crossover special, introducing the crew to an island with extraordinary edible wildlife.

events.title: Toriko's First Appearance in One Piece
events.description: Luffy, Nami, Sanji, and Chopper encounter Toriko, a gourmet hunter from another series, along with his chef companion Komatsu. Toriko initially mistakes Chopper for food.
events.significance: Marks the first crossover appearance of Toriko characters in the One Piece anime, establishing the collaboration between the two series.

events.title: Luffy and Toriko vs Hungry-La Bird
events.description: After clearing up their initial misunderstanding and encountering Barbecue Pigs, Luffy and Toriko team up to hunt and defeat a large Hungry-La Bird for food.
events.significance: First demonstration of Luffy and Toriko's fighting chemistry and shared passion for food and adventure.

events.title: Nami and Komatsu Kidnapped by Cocoalas
events.description: As the group spends the night enjoying their hunted spoils, Nami and Komatsu are kidnapped by a group of Cocoalas, small cocoa-bean creatures.
events.significance: Creates the central conflict and rescue mission that drives the remainder of the episode.

events.title: Coco and Sunny Appear
events.description: As Luffy, Toriko, Sanji, and Chopper head toward a mountain where a delicious fruit is said to exist, they face fierce lions but are aided by Toriko's allies, Coco and Sunny.
events.significance: Introduces additional characters from the Toriko series to assist in the rescue mission.

events.title: Battle with Knock-Out Koala
events.description: The rescue team finds Nami and Komatsu being held captive by a Knock-Out Koala, the adult form of the Cocoalas. This powerful creature is noted by Toriko to be quite strong, fast, and intelligent.
events.significance: Main antagonist battle of the episode, requiring the combined efforts of Luffy and Toriko to overcome.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Kugi Punch Debut
events.description: Luffy and Toriko work together to defeat the Knock-Out Koala using a combination technique called 'Gomu Gomu no Kugi Punch', demonstrating their teamwork.
events.significance: First and only use of this non-canon combination technique between Luffy and Toriko.

events.title: Hungry-La Island's True Nature Revealed
events.description: An eruption occurs, revealing that the entire Hungry-La Island is actually one giant dessert - a natural pudding à la mode. The ancient texts had a transcription error confusing the kanji for 'bird' and 'island'.
events.significance: Major revelation about the island's nature, explaining that the legendary ingredient was the island itself rather than a bird. Shows the whimsical food-based world of Toriko.

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Hungry-La Island
events.description: After gathering the provisions they need, the Straw Hat crew sets off on their journey. Toriko continues his search for his Full Course Menu, with both parties promising to meet again.
events.significance: Concludes the crossover special and returns both series to their respective storylines.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's typical enthusiasm when encountering food

themes.description: The episode showcases how characters from different series can work together when they share common goals and values, particularly their love of food and adventure.
themes.symbolism: The teamwork between Luffy and Toriko symbolizes the collaboration between the two manga series.
culturalReferences: Cross-series collaboration celebrating Toriko anime debut

themes.description: Both Luffy and Toriko are driven by their desire to explore and discover, whether it's the One Piece or ingredients for a Full Course Menu.
themes.symbolism: The island itself being the treasure represents the journey being as important as the destination.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his ability to quickly befriend others and work as a team, even with characters from different worlds.
keyActions: Teams up with Toriko to hunt the Hungry-La Bird
Participates in rescue mission for Nami and Komatsu
Uses combination attack with Toriko against Knock-Out Koala

characterSpotlights.development: Toriko is introduced as a powerful gourmet hunter with a similar passionate personality to Luffy, establishing the chemistry between the two series.
keyActions: Teams up with Luffy to hunt
Leads rescue mission with help from allies Coco and Sunny

mangaDifferences.difference: This episode is anime-original and has no direct manga counterpart in One Piece. It is based on a separate manga crossover special.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final use of 'One day' by The ROOTLESS as a theme song, with it being repurposed from an opening to an ending for this special episode.
This is one of only two One Piece episodes (along with Episode 542) that Funimation did not dub into English, as they did not have the rights to Toriko at the time.
The episode aired as part of a 1-hour special, serving as both One Piece Episode 492 and Toriko Episode 1.
The TV rating for this episode achieved 10.8%, ranking third in its time slot.
Unlike the manga crossover which featured the post-timeskip Straw Hats, this anime crossover shows them in their pre-timeskip appearances.
